11 Numbers

Numbers have a number of useful methods:

Number.tostring

tostring(self) -> String:  end

Number.tostring-fixed

tostring-fixed(self, num-digits) -> String:

  

where:

  (4 / 3).tostring-fixed(5) is '1.33333'

  (4 / 5).tostring-fixed(4) is '0.8000'

  (2 / 3).tostring-fixed(3) is '0.667'

end

Produces a fixed-precision string representation of the number, with the specified number of digits

The natural logarithm of this number
Number.exp

exp(self) -> Number:  end

Euler’s number raised to this number
Number.expt

expt(self, power :: Number) -> Number:  end

This number raised to the specified power
Number.exact

exact(self) -> Number:  end

Some functions and methods, like substring, require exact numbers as arguments. This method returns an exact version of this number suitable for such functions.
